title: Skyshark
data:

|   | Skysharks cut through the air with a thoughtless ease. Just a taste of blood gives them an enraged strength, and further morsels drive them into a frenzy. |

## Useful Info

**Skysharks** are fast and deadly denizens of the [Lair](/Lair "Lair") and [Shoals](/Shoals "Shoals"). They can also be found in the company of [Norris](/Norris "Norris"). Skysharks get more dangerous after they taste [blood](/Blood "Blood"): at first they get the [Might](/Might "Might") status (+50% damage) for 10-20 [turns](/Decaaut "Decaaut"), and then they can go [berserk](/Berserk "Berserk"), also for the same duration.

## Tips & Tricks

- If a skyshark can't taste blood, it can't go berserk. [Undead](/Undead "Undead") species, [Djinn](/Djinn "Djinn"), and [Gargoyles](/Gargoyle "Gargoyle") don't have blood, so are immune to bloodzerk. For living species, a [potion of lignification](/Potion_of_lignification "Potion of lignification") will turn you into a bloodless tree, and gives hefty [AC](/AC "AC") to boot. [Statue Form](/Statue_Form "Statue Form"), [Storm Form](/Storm_Form "Storm Form") and [Death Form](/Death_Form "Death Form") will turn you bloodless, though by the time you have these forms you should be able to take on one with ease.

- They don't have any resistances, and their [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") is relatively low. You can disable them from a distance using hex [wands](/Wands "Wands"), [curare](/Curare "Curare") [darts](/Dart "Dart"), etc.

  - Skysharks will happily charge into [poisonous](/Scroll_of_poison "Scroll of poison") or [freezing](/Freezing_Cloud "Freezing Cloud") clouds, but will take heavy damage in the process. If you have [poison resistance](/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), you can [kite](/Kite "Kite") the skyshark through the poisonous clouds to kill it.
  - Skysharks are good targets for [Mephitic Cloud](/Mephitic_Cloud "Mephitic Cloud"). Watch out, though, since a [confused](/Confused "Confused") skyshark can become enraged if it hits another monster (even if you don't have blood yourself).
  - Skysharks are [cold-blooded](/Cold-blooded "Cold-blooded") and will be [slowed](/Slow "Slow") by [cold](/Cold "Cold") attacks.

## History

- Skysharks have been added in [0.30](/0.30 "0.30").
html:
Skyshark

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
skyshark l 
HP 49-100
HD 10
XP 778
Speed 10 (move: 70%)
AC 6
EV 8
Will 40
Attack1 20 (bite: bloodzerk)
Attack2 10 (tail slap: plain)
Attack3 10 (tail slap: plain)
Resistances None
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Animal
Uses Uses nothing
Holiness Natural
Size Large
Type skyshark, skyshark
Flags No skeleton
Cold-blooded
Flying
Skysharks cut through the air with a thoughtless ease. Just a taste of blood gives them an enraged strength, and further morsels drive them into a frenzy.

Useful Info

Skysharks are fast and deadly denizens of the Lair and Shoals. They can also be found in the company of Norris. Skysharks get more dangerous after they taste blood: at first they get the Might status (+50% damage) for 10-20 turns, and then they can go berserk, also for the same duration.

Tips & Tricks

  • If a skyshark can't taste blood, it can't go berserk. Undead species, Djinn, and Gargoyles don't have blood, so are immune to bloodzerk. For living species, a potion of lignification will turn you into a bloodless tree, and gives hefty AC to boot. Statue Form, Storm Form and Death Form will turn you bloodless, though by the time you have these forms you should be able to take on one with ease.
  • They don't have any resistances, and their willpower is relatively low. You can disable them from a distance using hex wands, curare darts, etc.
    • Skysharks will happily charge into poisonous or freezing clouds, but will take heavy damage in the process. If you have poison resistance, you can kite the skyshark through the poisonous clouds to kill it.
    • Skysharks are good targets for Mephitic Cloud. Watch out, though, since a confused skyshark can become enraged if it hits another monster (even if you don't have blood yourself).
    • Skysharks are cold-blooded and will be slowed by cold attacks.

History

  • Skysharks have been added in 0.30.
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Skyshark&oldid=80349"

rawPage:
{{version031}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Skysharks''' are fast and deadly denizens of the [[Lair]] and [[Shoals]]. They can also be found in the company of [[Norris]]. Skysharks get more dangerous after they taste [[blood]]: at first they get the [[Might]] status (+50% damage) for 10-20 [[decaaut|turns]], and then they can go [[berserk]], also for the same duration.

==Tips & Tricks==
*If a skyshark can't taste blood, it can't go berserk. [[Undead]] species, [[Djinn]], and [[Gargoyle]]s don't have blood, so are immune to bloodzerk. For living species, a [[potion of lignification]] will turn you into a bloodless tree, and gives hefty [[AC]] to boot. [[Statue Form]], [[Storm Form]] and [[Death Form]] will turn you bloodless, though by the time you have these forms you should be able to take on one with ease.
*They don't have any resistances, and their [[willpower]] is relatively low. You can disable them from a distance using hex [[wands]], [[curare]] [[dart]]s, etc.
**Skysharks will happily charge into [[scroll of poison|poisonous]] or [[Freezing Cloud|freezing]] clouds, but will take heavy damage in the process. If you have [[poison resistance]], you can [[kite]] the skyshark through the poisonous clouds to kill it.
**Skysharks are good targets for [[Mephitic Cloud]]. Watch out, though, since a [[confused]] skyshark can become enraged if it hits another monster (even if you don't have blood yourself).
**Skysharks are [[cold-blooded]] and will be [[slow]]ed by [[cold]] attacks.

==History==
*Skysharks have been added in [[0.30]].
